docs.title: Virtual Environment
docs.description: A virtual environment in Python is a self-contained directory that encapsulates a specific Python interpreter and a set of libraries or packages. It allows you to create isolated environments for different Python projects, each with its own dependencies, without interfering with the global Python environment or other projects.
docs.code:
# Create a new virtual environment
python -m venv /path/to/virtualenv

# Enable the virtual environment
source /path/to/virtualenv/bin/activate

# Install packages if applicable
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Disable the virtual environment
deactivate

docs.title: Requirements.txt
docs.description: The requirements.txt file contains a list of packages that are required to run the project. The list
